The message tasks in case of failures should reference the task to

Change-Id: Ie05bd113b8c20ee95aef82b07c63a9591baab98a

commit_message:
Fix typos in container_images_prepare failure task names

The message tasks in case of failures should reference the task to
prepare the container images itself. In the case of create_plan, it
would return a message for the wrong task, and in the case of
update_plan I think it would fail altogether. This now references the
correct task name.

Change-Id: Ie05bd113b8c20ee95aef82b07c63a9591baab98a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/20/516720/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: message: <% task(container_images_prepare).result %> message: <% task(container_images_prepare).result %>

commit_message:
os-net-config not run when conf is empty and re-introduce exception.

There may be cases where os-net-config is empty leading to issue when
we force the run during its special treatment in upgrade/update.

Piggy back in this review is re-adding the os-net-config special
handling to update and non-controller.  But it’s more robust now it
won’t run the command unconditionally, it needs:
 - os-net-config to be upgraded
 - /etc/os-net-config/config.json to exist and not be empty.

Another improvement is that it will prevent any networking cut during
its run as we are using the –no-activate flag.

Change-Id: Ie1b88d5cac22fca5b0b325b1dd8c81d65b63acb8
Closes-Bug: #1728889

added_lines: declare -f update_os_net_config > $UPGRADE_SCRIPT

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-18 09:04:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/c32ec16e4a852e98e8a46eafdf7769d865ffd8d7', 'message': 'Fix using old Swift rings when creating a new stack

The container to store Swift rings is not deleted when the stack is

commit_message:
Fix using old Swift rings when creating a new stack

The container to store Swift rings is not deleted when the stack is
deleted. This results in re-deploying old rings when deploying a new
stack.

This patch creates a copy of the old rings with a timestamp suffix and
removes the original object. Doing this will create new rings when
creating a new stack.

Closes-Bug: 1671783
Change-Id: Ie6363987ada9b516064c1ed3b215f809c3924393
(cherry picked from commit f82064e95a60b63c0c6a1df92a70f33158bc1a18)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/86/504886/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swiftclient import exceptions as swiftexceptions swift_client = self.get_object_client() try: swift_client.copy_object( "%s-swift-rings" % self.container, "swift-rings.tar.gz", "%s-swift-rings/%s-%d" % ( self.container, "swift-rings.tar.gz", time.time())) swift_client.delete_object( "%s-swift-rings" % self.container, "swift-rings.tar.gz") except swiftexceptions.ClientException: pass

commit_message:
[upstream] Add slides on 'WIP' patches to Workflow

It was discussed after the class in Boston that we might want
to add something about 'Work In Progress' patches in the
workflow section somewhere.  After looking through the content the
best place to put it seemed to be in the 'Reviewing' section as
that allowed to tell how a 'WIP' could be indicated and then how
that should be handled from a review standpoint.

This patch adds a couple of slides to cover the topic.

Change-Id: Icf77b248e4cfddf1d6efd5fa1d8b0a94fefdc76d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-26 18:04:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5a65e974d5cf0b302a59cab41c7d3b537862ac75', 'message': 'Always call iptables-restore with -w if done once

In the case where we called iptables-restore with a
-w argument and it succeeded, we should short-circuit
future calls to always use -w, instead of trying
without it, just to fall-back to using it on failure.

While analyzing some l3-agent log files I have seen
lots of "Perhaps you want to use the -w option?",
followed by a call with -w, followed by not using it
the next time. Changing this can save one failing
call to iptables-restore.

Change-Id: Icac99eb1d43648c64b6beaee0d6201f990eacb51
Related-bug: #1712185
(cherry picked from commit 6c50ad5858175e2eddeed7a3e28cf8b53c2eb2b3)
'}]
commit_message:
Always call iptables-restore with -w if done once

In the case where we called iptables-restore with a
-w argument and it succeeded, we should short-circuit
future calls to always use -w, instead of trying
without it, just to fall-back to using it on failure.

While analyzing some l3-agent log files I have seen
lots of "Perhaps you want to use the -w option?",
followed by a call with -w, followed by not using it
the next time. Changing this can save one failing
call to iptables-restore.

Change-Id: Icac99eb1d43648c64b6beaee0d6201f990eacb51
Related-bug: #1712185
(cherry picked from commit 6c50ad5858175e2eddeed7a3e28cf8b53c2eb2b3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/88/515488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import fixturesclass IptablesFixture(fixtures.Fixture): def _setUp(self): # We MUST save and restore use_table_lock because it is a class # attribute and could change state in some tests, which can cause # the other iptables_manager test cases to randomly fail due to # race conditions. self.use_table_lock = iptables_manager.IptablesManager.use_table_lock iptables_manager.IptablesManager.use_table_lock = False self.addCleanup(self._reset) def _reset(self): iptables_manager.IptablesManager.use_table_lock = self.use_table_lock self.execute = mock.patch.object(linux_utils, "execute").start() self.useFixture(IptablesFixture()) def test_iptables_use_table_lock(self): # Under normal operation, if we do call iptables-restore with a -w # and it succeeds, the next call will only use -w. PE_error = linux_utils.ProcessExecutionError( "", iptables_manager.XTABLES_RESOURCE_PROBLEM_CODE) self.execute.side_effect = [FILTER_DUMP, PE_error, None, FILTER_DUMP, None, FILTER_DUMP, None] self.iptables._apply_synchronized() self.assertEqual(3, self.execute.call_count) self.execute.assert_has_calls( [mock.call(['iptables-save'], run_as_root=True), mock.call(['iptables-restore', '-n'], process_input=mock.ANY, run_as_root=True, log_fail_as_error=False), mock.call(['iptables-restore', '-n', '-w', '10'], process_input=mock.ANY, run_as_root=True)]) self.execute.reset_mock() self.iptables._apply_synchronized() self.assertEqual(2, self.execute.call_count) self.execute.assert_has_calls( [mock.call(['iptables-save'], run_as_root=True), mock.call(['iptables-restore', '-n', '-w', '10'], process_input=mock.ANY, run_as_root=True)]) # Another instance of the class should behave similarly now self.execute.reset_mock() iptm = iptables_manager.IptablesManager() iptm._apply_synchronized() self.assertEqual(2, self.execute.call_count) self.execute.assert_has_calls( [mock.call(['iptables-save'], run_as_root=True), mock.call(['iptables-restore', '-n', '-w', '10'], process_input=mock.ANY, run_as_root=True)])

commit_message:
Docker: disable iptables modification on startup

This PS stops docker inserting iptables rules on startup.

Change-Id: Ic21cc889c911e0a8add882653934113693f2fd5b

commit_message:
Ceph: Import Ceph chart into openstack-helm infra

This PS imports the ceph chart into openstack-helm infra and sets
up credentials to use rbd devices in the openstack namespace.

Change-Id: I36d8e9a2aad9bc853ce2aeda4da4500dc2594ba7

Add openstack/puppet-modulesync-configs to puppet jobs

ported yet.

subject: Change OVS agent to update skipped port status to DOWN
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-27 13:48:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/93b05e3cb8362e8e38e33088902cbda975dd3517', 'message': "Change OVS agent to update skipped port status to DOWN

When the OVS agent skips processing a port because it was
not found on the integration bridge, it doesn't send back
any status to the server to notify it.  This can cause the
port to get stuck in the BUILD state indefinitely, since
that is the default state it gets before the server tells
the agent to update it.

The OVS agent will now notify the server that any skipped
device should be considered DOWN if it did not exist.

Change-Id: I15dc55951cdb75c6d87d7c645f8e2cbf82b2f3e4
Closes-bug: #1719011
(cherry picked from commit a789d23b0242ae3b4c13856e96a72a3acc5a3697)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-27 18:35:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c6044fb86174caa5ec142a60a1f442764b935e5a', 'message': "Change OVS agent to update skipped port status to DOWN

When the OVS agent skips processing a port because it was
not found on the integration bridge, it doesn't send back
any status to the server to notify it.  This can cause the
port to get stuck in the BUILD state indefinitely, since
that is the default state it gets before the server tells
the agent to update it.

The OVS agent will now notify the server that any skipped
device should be considered DOWN if it did not exist.

Conflicts:
 neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I15dc55951cdb75c6d87d7c645f8e2cbf82b2f3e4

commit_message:
Change OVS agent to update skipped port status to DOWN

When the OVS agent skips processing a port because it was
not found on the integration bridge, it doesn't send back
any status to the server to notify it.  This can cause the
port to get stuck in the BUILD state indefinitely, since
that is the default state it gets before the server tells
the agent to update it.

The OVS agent will now notify the server that any skipped
device should be considered DOWN if it did not exist.

Conflicts:
 neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I15dc55951cdb75c6d87d7c645f8e2cbf82b2f3e4
Closes-bug: #1719011
(cherry picked from commit a789d23b0242ae3b4c13856e96a72a3acc5a3697)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/15/515715/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'removed'])) as device_removed,\ mock.patch.object(self.agent, "treat_devices_skipped", return_value=( skipped_devices)) as device_skipped: if skipped_devices: device_skipped.assert_called_once_with(set(skipped_devices))

commit_message:
Change OVS agent to update skipped port status to DOWN

When the OVS agent skips processing a port because it was
not found on the integration bridge, it doesn't send back
any status to the server to notify it.  This can cause the
port to get stuck in the BUILD state indefinitely, since
that is the default state it gets before the server tells
the agent to update it.

The OVS agent will now notify the server that any skipped
device should be considered DOWN if it did not exist.

Change-Id: I15dc55951cdb75c6d87d7c645f8e2cbf82b2f3e4
Closes-bug: #1719011
(cherry picked from commit a789d23b0242ae3b4c13856e96a72a3acc5a3697)

add example basic resource generation scripts

added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # Copyright 2017, Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. source openrc # Create a basic flat network neutron net-create GATEWAY_NET \ --shared \ --router:external=True \ --provider:physical_network=flat \ --provider:network_type=flat neutron subnet-create GATEWAY_NET 172.16.24.0/22 \ --name GATEWAY_NET_SUBNET \ --gateway 172.16.24.2 \ --allocation-pool start=172.16.25.201,end=172.16.25.255 \ --dns-nameservers list=true 172.16.24.2 # Create a basic VXLAN network neutron net-create PRIVATE_NET \ --shared \ --router:external=True \ --provider:network_type=vxlan \ --provider:segmentation_id 101 neutron subnet-create PRIVATE_NET 192.168.0.0/24 \ --name PRIVATE_NET_SUBNET # Create a neutron router and wire it up to the GATEWAY_NET and PRIVATE_NET_SUBNET ROUTER_ID="$(neutron router-create GATEWAY_NET_ROUTER | grep -w id | awk '{print $4}')" neutron router-gateway-set \ "${ROUTER_ID}" \ "$(neutron net-list | awk '/GATEWAY_NET/ {print $2}')" neutron router-interface-add \ "${ROUTER_ID}" \ "$(neutron subnet-list | awk '/PRIVATE_NET_SUBNET/ {print $2}')" # Neutron security group setup for id in "$(neutron security-group-list -f yaml | awk '/- id\:/ {print $3}')"; do # Allow ICMP neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol icmp \ --direction ingress \ "$id" || true # Allow all TCP neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol tcp \ --port-range-min 1 \ --port-range-max 65535 \ --direction ingress \ "$id" || true # Allow all UDP neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol udp \ --port-range-min 1 \ --port-range-max 65535 -\ -direction ingress \ "$id" || true done

commit_message:
Remove fake_keystone

We now used Ansible (via 'config download') instead of the
os-collect config agent for local undercloud deployment.
This eliminates part of our Keystone dependencies...

This patch updates our heat.conf for the undercloud installer
so that it no longer requires a fake_keystone to be running
and instead uses a fake keystoneclient shim.

This patch also re-implements our event list code so that
rather than depend on openstackclient (which also
required the fake keystone API) we use heatclient's
library directly.

By a combination of the above we can eliminate use of
fake_keystone entirely and thus avoid spawning the
extra thread, socket, and associated cleanup.

Depends-On: I03f1789957ba157871fd13164592116d7fcdabe4
Depends-On: I5413ae4eadd5affdd1ae01678b61eafbe50b7919

Change-Id: Ic7a10a334b34190f406f05c4167c494a0092502b

Optional. Default: 35358.)') ) parser.add_argument( # NOTE(dprince): It would be nice if heat supported true 'noauth' # use in a local format for our use case here (or perhaps dev testing) # but until it does running our own lightweight shim to mock out # the required API calls works just as well. To keep fake keystone # light we run it in a thread. if not os.environ.get('FAKE_KEYSTONE_PORT'): os.environ['FAKE_KEYSTONE_PORT'] = parsed_args.fake_keystone_port keystone_pid = self._fork_fake_keystone() parsed_args.fake_keystone_port, parsed_args.fake_keystone_port, self._wait_local_port_ready(parsed_args.fake_keystone_port) if keystone_pid: os.kill(keystone_pid, signal.SIGKILL)

commit_message:
Log additional info about entries

In order to pinpoint bugs better it's necessary to log more details
about the entries. The entry id will now be logged to better correlate
the entry processing.
Also dependencies will be logged to better understand if bugs in
dependency calculations exist.

Change-Id: I9078487bd4722132e92b48d7d333c93c82a002d9
Partial-Bug: #1713487

commit_message:
Make configuration files more readable

In order to make OpenStack configuration files written by Chef more
readable, this patch introduces a blank line before every section
heading.

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: Ie91c2465947b5f693eb605eb44b01982e2b19c7b

commit_message:
Restrict launch fields when restoring from backup

When restoring from backup the launch wizard contains all options
and performs no customizations based on the information contained
in the backup.

This patch adds support for restricting the launch instance
datastore field to the datastore and datastore version that the
backup is relevant to.

It also populates the restored backup as the only option in the
advanced step backup field.

Added a unit test to validate the fields were populated correctly.

Change-Id: Iabfefd34b5f7a24699277104fa92ac77b2c74fe3
Closes-Bug: #1647746

commit_message:
Fix to use . to source script files

Refer to ``Code conventions`` at [1] for details.
When you have to source a script file, for example, a credentials file
to gain access to user-only or admin-only CLI commands,
use . instead of source.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Ie59c58662c85e22d5651cfc8891181b8dfeb07c9

commit_message:
Deprecated the V1 drivers

The V1 drivers are not actively maintained by the networking-odl team
for a few cycles already and aren't guaranteed to even work.
As such, the networking-odl team has decided [1] that the drivers will
be marked as deprecated beginning Queens cycle, and removed in the
beginning of the Rocky cycle.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/networking-odl-queens-ptg

Change-Id: Id55fea31d2e4cff5eea6e385fe26e351a50cc369
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/95/514595/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > V1 drivers are marked depracated beginning with Queens cycle, to be removed in Rocky cycle. deprecations: - The V1 drivers are not actively maintained by the networking-odl team for a few cycles already and aren't guaranteed to even work. As such, the networking-odl team has decided that the drivers will be marked as deprecated beginning Queens cycle, and removed in the beginning of the Rocky cycle. If you're still using the V1 drivers, please switch to using the V2 drivers by updating the appropriate configuration values.

Change developer_mode branch to newton-eol

Now that the service repo has been tagged EOL, the branch
no longer exists, so to allow the role to continue to be
deployed we should switch developer_mode to using it.

commit_message:
Fix the wrong usage of new style class in metering

This problem will cause self.host to be overridden by cfg.CONF.host
instead of the passed host value when calling MeteringAgent.__init__(host).

Change-Id: I50c5136e1cf1eb0db28edd02129f963948a54741
(cherry picked from commit 9dffd9b391ee50a69a39863cc18e5fe1ebdd3e65)

does not exist or Keystone does not have sufficient permission to access
it: /etc/keystone/credential-keys/

[1] commit 5279aa4fbc6e2885e86954105237c94d71890f20

'}]
commit_message:
Re-add keystone-manage credential_setup

The step that ran keystone-manage credential_setup has been removed
as "deprecated" with the "Initial identity Pike updates" [1].

However, the Pike CLI documentation for keystone-manage does not
indicate that the command is deprecated [2] and the install-guide
continues to use it [3].

Also, I got this error message on a Pike installation (Ubuntu):

ERROR keystone.common.fernet_utils [...] Either [credential] key_repository
does not exist or Keystone does not have sufficient permission to access
it: /etc/keystone/credential-keys/

For these reasons, this patch reinstates the keystone-manage
credential_setup step.

[1] commit 5279aa4fbc6e2885e86954105237c94d71890f20
    (Change-Id: I518ed83f7e19c590e7846160889faf46db274b3a)
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/pike/cli/index.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/pike/install/keystone-install-ubuntu.html

Change-Id: Iad5afd70ab99d968a6546bd19e5e5831a8299a49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity refs/changes/94/517294/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: notifies :run, 'execute[credential setup]', :immediately end execute 'credential setup' do user 'root' command <<-EOH.gsub(/\s+/, ' ').strip! keystone-manage credential_setup --keystone-user #{keystone_user} --keystone-group #{keystone_group} EOH

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Depends-On: I4f4cc284ab7d1c3378e01737f9fade3afe251824
Depends-On: If151501923c5308cfeaee6e33d12df3e7f6959d5
Change-Id: I519e26a34ba391fdeb6043647d8f2bdfec086d70

subject: Fix meter-label-rule creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-18 09:19:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/1b77d9a4196e1cc803d6c07096a7e0b719516426', 'message': 'Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM to a
specific "remote_ip_address"(in case of outbound), but the method I suggested can
meter outgoing traffic from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view, it does not matter which address/CIDR is
the destination for outbound. But, it is important to know where(subnet
or VM) the packet leaves from. That way you can see how much VMs are using
the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs and for
inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct to specify src address for
"remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound and specify dst address for
inbound. If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix", you need to
clarify this option.

Change-Id: I2f11ad0d80d83872b6ebc6129b865760900de30f

commit_message:
Fix meter-label-rule creation

The existing method is to meter outgoing traffic from the entire VM
to a specific "remote_ip_addr"(in case of outbound),
but the method I suggested can meter outgoing traffic
from a particular subnet to external network.

From a metering point of view,
it does not matter which address/CIDR is the destination for outbound.
But, it is important to know where(subnet or VM) the packet leaves from.
That way you can see how much VMs are using the external network.
For outbound metering, dst is 0.0.0.0/0 and src is network of VMs
and for inbound metering, src is 0.0.0.0/0 and dst is network of VMs.

When creating a meter-label-rule, it is correct
to specify src address for "remote_ip_prefix" option for outbound
and specify dst address for inbound.
If you are confused by the term "remote_ip_prefix",
you need to clarify this option.

Change-Id: I2f11ad0d80d83872b6ebc6129b865760900de30f
Closes-Bug: #1716913

commit_message:
fullstack: Remove ovsdb_interface config opt

ovsdb_interface option was deprecated [1]. Fullstack tests are
still not stable so removing tests using ovs-vsctl interface from
fullstack won't remove much of testing coverage but removal will
simplify the testing matrix a lot.

[1] Change Ieb2b8916d4cdbb3b7e6a953c827b176f2217a42f

Change-Id: I2655e403c2a63038035048a9ada985c471437367

subject: Add 'done' to migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node filter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-11 23:05:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/936b0d298f0ae452bb84716b7e07b1e2564659da', 'message': "Fix migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node status list

This DB API method is returning all in-progress migration
records for a given host and node.

It determines what is in-progress by filtering out migration
status values for things that mean NOT in progress.

There are a couple of issues with this:

1. 'accepted' is an in-progress starting state for evacuate
   and live migration operations.

2. 'done' is an end state for a successful evacuation, so it
   should be included in the list of things that are not in
   progress.

So this change removes 'accepted' from and adds 'done' to the
list of *not* in-progress states used for filtering in this method.

Change-Id: I294fb28d279979f6e3409f1530a553dd525e53da
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-11 23:47:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/299a5496f0979dbec8e0b6f25a58a282a55e8699', 'message': "Add 'done' to migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node filter

This DB API method is returning all in-progress migration
records for a given host and node.

It determines what is in-progress by filtering out migration
status values for things that mean NOT in progress.

However, 'done' is an end state for a successful evacuation,
so it should be included in the list of things that are not in
progress.

Change-Id: I294fb28d279979f6e3409f1530a553dd525e53da
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'done' to migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node filter

This DB API method is returning all in-progress migration
records for a given host and node.

It determines what is in-progress by filtering out migration
status values for things that mean NOT in progress.

However, 'done' is an end state for a successful evacuation,
so it should be included in the list of things that are not in
progress.

Change-Id: I294fb28d279979f6e3409f1530a553dd525e53da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/511351/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rework r10k verbose option

The command "r10k puppetfile install -v" fails with:
Unrecognized options: verbose.

Rework the command to be compatible with the r10k 1.1.4.

Closes-bug: #1707629

Change-Id: I05d888125284d2808fb248e52afc95ab2b948353
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bogdando@mail.ru>
(cherry picked from commit 885abd1ae0f604fae73fe262493d3b5598613cd0)

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I264fed2cf01f3e0ba1104b52e0c2a9562c316854

commit_message:
Add some check for zuul.d/projects.yaml

Add framework to run checks on zuul.d/projects.yaml.

For now it checks that each project has the system-required template
and that zuul.d/projects.yaml is sorted.

Remove the file tools/zuul-projects_sorted.sh which did a sort test as
well.

Update list of repos so that they are in the order expected (bash and
python string comparison is different).

Change-Id: I29e0b7f49ec890f62d6c521e443248ab33cb819a
Depends-On: I19dbdebc1c02f0ae6ab6671b4cf3fb3c4382a820

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-11 07:41:52.000000000', 'files': ['trove_dashboard/content/database_configurations/tables.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove-dashboard/commit/68800dee81597c934c01ee099b83712ec8787b96', 'message': 'Fix bug: Trove dashboard makes openstack dashboard not work.

commit_message:
Fix bug: Trove dashboard makes openstack dashboard not work.

It is caused by that: the DeleteConfiguration and DeleteParameter
class in database_configurations/tables.py must have both action_past
and action_present methods while they not.

Change-Id: I2596efdc974440d396e6788bc301c9a04982ba00
Closes-Bug: #1690003
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-dashboard refs/changes/29/463929/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def action_present(count): return ungettext_lazy( u"Delete Configuration", u"Delete Configurations", count ) @staticmethod def action_past(count): return ungettext_lazy( u"Scheduled deletion of Configuration", u"Scheduled deletion of Configurations", count ) @staticmethod def action_present(count): return ungettext_lazy( u"Delete Parameter", u"Delete Parameters", count ) @staticmethod def action_past(count): return ungettext_lazy( u"Scheduled deletion of Parameter", u"Scheduled deletion of Parameters", count )

commit_message:
Add image_member_quota to Glance API configuration

Allow the configuration of image_member_quota
in Glance API. This error blocks the ability
of sharing images if the default value (128)
is reached.

Closes-bug: 1724879
Change-Id: Idc72c85943baf3d720500d2c30a813663f2927da
(cherry picked from commit 72984f9f12c5408e0391f9cbc30cf861feb914fa)

Vagrantfile: Remove openSUSE Leap 42.2

openSUSE Leap 42.2 has reached EOL and it shouldn't be used anymore.
The Vagrantfile already supports Leap 42.3

commit_message:
RHSM: do not use retry to deploy katello-agent

katello-agent is an optional package, we don't want to use retry.
The package is available or not.

Fixing a regression from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386529
Since we use "| true", we can't really use "retry" here.

Change-Id: Id8cd9ac54e158ee1743b2f72b169b3a066f69168
Closes-Bug: #1728614
(cherry picked from commit d9f7b01c6c21b306005bad12fcab103b0a9e7591)

added_lines: yum install -y katello-agent || true # needed for errata reporting to satellite6
deleted_lines: retry yum install -y katello-agent || true # needed for errata reporting to satellite6

commit_message:
migration: Superceed use of 'ceph mon rm'

Use the remove command (instead of rm) which is supported in
Ceph firefly or later (which covers all current deployment targets).

This resolves an issue with the ceph -> ceph-mon/ceph-osd migration
process for Luminous based deployments.

Change-Id: I127930e7c4b80465796b8270a9966b08f7c03037
Closes-Bug: 1729370
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph refs/changes/20/517220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ['ceph', 'mon', 'remove', 'myself']

commit_message:
Only run checks on open patches

We don't want 'recheck' comments to trigger checks on merged patches.

Change-Id: I0b4a56e86563fd47a7a147aa920dcd147ca3548e

commit_message:
Cleanup old legacy jobs no longer referenced

As part of I247993de1149cced97170363d97f066b2bc1203b we removed the
tripleo jobs from the puppet projects. This removed the only reference
for the tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp_1ceph-featureset024-puppet-*
jobs so let's remove the playbooks and jobs as well.

Change-Id: I78a659dd2bb1fb72bf54f097b5a7c4b8a044338d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs refs/changes/67/517367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-30 16:55:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6ca25acfdc7fa126a960fd79e60370398c21ff7c', 'message': "WIP: libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks
to see if the instance base directory (which contains the domain xml
files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a
volume-backed instance and if the instance base directory is on shared
storage, e.g. NFS, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

This adds a check to see if the instance is volume-backed when checking
to see if the instance base directory should be removed from the source
host when confirming a resize.

Depends-On: Id7de5186b2ea0ff7af86d9950c69203914498d88

Change-Id: I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks

files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a

storage, e.g. NFS or Ceph, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

Change-Id: I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a
Closes-Bug: #1728603
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: do not remove inst_base when volume-backed during resize

When confirming a resize, the libvirt driver on the source host checks
to see if the instance base directory (which contains the domain xml
files, etc) exists and if the root disk image does not, it removes the
instance base directory.

However, the root image disk won't exist on local storage for a
volume-backed instance and if the instance base directory is on shared
storage, e.g. NFS or Ceph, between the source and destination host, the
instance base directory is incorrectly deleted.

This adds a check to see if the instance is volume-backed when checking
to see if the instance base directory should be removed from the source
host when confirming a resize.

Change-Id: I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a
Closes-Bug: #1728603

commit_message:
Change Amphora flavor from public to private

In octavia, when create specified nova flavor for Amphora,
it's supposed to be accessed by octavia for creating Amphora instances,
and other projetcs/users shouldn't get this flavor[1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L396

Closes-Bug: #1729450
Change-Id: I1d2b74dd99d949263e24b62c427c8718ec8de5b0

commit_message:
Add octavia::client class

This patch adds new class octavia::client to manage client,
note that it only supports Debian and Ubuntu, b/c there is
no available rpm package in CentOS currently.

Change-Id: I8f44676a3923702cfdaffa3a0aee3f84074321d1

commit_message:
Explicitly set REVIEW_RELEASE on master

REVIEW_RELEASE defaults to STABLE_RELEASE in tripleo.sh, but for
master upgrade jobs we don't want that.  For stable to stable
upgrades we explicitly set both variables, but on master we rely
on the tripleo.sh default, which is wrong.  We should also set
REVIEW_RELEASE explicitly on stable to master upgrade jobs.

This also adds REVIEW_RELEASE to deploy.env.  I'm not positive it's
necessary, but the intent is that deploy.env represents all of the
variables needed for the deployment so it should be there.

Reverts the change in Ib70130e81fd10907cbba666c7daa86491a8a3eed as
that changes the behavior of tripleo.sh for local use.

Change-Id: I47e99e30aa189cf4075d328cd4b40429892e0ef3
Closes-Bug: 1677062

because we just aren't capturing enough, this patch removes the

commit_message:
Capture more of the bmc console log

I've seen some IPMI errors in jobs lately, but the console log we
capture from the bmc doesn't indicate any problems.  In case that's
because we just aren't capturing enough, this patch removes the
tail call so we save the entire console log.

We may want to revert this in the interest of te-broker storage
space after we've tracked down the problem, but we should be good
to run this way for a while at least.

Change-Id: I7fadc2261e8a938b8e353bb23fcca567c628eef0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/91/451591/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: nova console-log bmc-${ENVNUM} | tail -n 100 | awk -v envnum="$ENVNUM" '$0=envnum ": " $0' >> /var/log/bmc-console-logs

subject: Stop client-side validation of login form
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-30 20:11:06.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/templates/auth/_login_form.html'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/de5c8b5013eb5a82189d4622724facf659216194', 'message': "Stop client-side validation of login form

When allowed to perform HTML5 form validation, browsers use the
'required' attribute of form fields to prevalidate input. This causes a
problem when WebSSO is enabled and the user selects an authentication
format that doesn't use a username and password field. In this case, the
fields are still labeled 'required' but are not visible to the user, and
so attempting to submit the form results in a validation error even
though the input is valid. This patch adds the novalidate tag to the
login form to disable client-side validation. The server-side validation
is smarter about which fields are really required, and still produces
correct error messages if the user selects credential authentication but
leaves the username and password fields empty.

Change-Id: Ie2fa75fedaf37cb22cabac0aec1d28583b2a177c
Closes-bug: #1703109
"}]
commit_message:
Stop client-side validation of login form

When allowed to perform HTML5 form validation, browsers use the
'required' attribute of form fields to prevalidate input. This causes a
problem when WebSSO is enabled and the user selects an authentication
format that doesn't use a username and password field. In this case, the
fields are still labeled 'required' but are not visible to the user, and
so attempting to submit the form results in a validation error even
though the input is valid. This patch adds the novalidate tag to the
login form to disable client-side validation. The server-side validation
is smarter about which fields are really required, and still produces
correct error messages if the user selects credential authentication but
leaves the username and password fields empty.

Change-Id: Ie2fa75fedaf37cb22cabac0aec1d28583b2a177c
Closes-bug: #1703109
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/39/516439/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I1cade44ae93b6d198852f62dbd5a694bc2e98ad6

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Included is the backport of https://review.openstack.org/515376

Change-Id: Iab55d542ec8cb3e8a26216977b4aabbda25a6c86

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I5ea785cb3592b409dee9e354aeb78bd3d7246ef0

commit_message:
Modify ARP responder behavior from configuration

Make ARP responder able to reply to all IP addresses or only for gateway
depending on configuration

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: I38480263cd65a4c172722ad5c2eefd191d99c8e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/38/516738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vrf_match = self._vrf_match( 'dl_dst=ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff,NXM_OF_ARP_OP[]=0x1', proto='arp' ) # Respond to all IP addresses if , otherwise only for gateway if not self.driver.proxy_arp: vrf_match += ',arp_tpa=%s' % self.gateway_ip self._ovs_flow_add(vrf_match, actions, self.driver.vrf_table) # Map ARP responder if necessary if not self._ovs_port_info: self.setup_arp_responder(ovs_port) self.remove_arp_responder() cfg.BoolOpt("proxy_arp", default=False, help=("Activate ARP responder per VRF for all IP " "addresses (Only for gateway IP by default)")),
deleted_lines: self._ovs_flow_add( self._vrf_match('dl_dst=ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff,NXM_OF_ARP_OP[]=0x1', proto='arp'), actions, self.driver.vrf_table) if self.driver.proxy_arp: # Map ARP responder if necessary if not self._ovs_port_info: self.setup_arp_responder(ovs_port) if self.driver.proxy_arp: self.remove_arp_responder() cfg.BoolOpt("proxy_arp", default=True, help=("Setup ARP responder per VRF")),

Update test image for nova-lxd

In https://review.openstack.org/513200 the var specifying
the image was updated to a different structure and some
vars were removed. This updates the override to the new
structure.

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: I7e3ca8fa9a48f3308dec46eda4ccf7e76d7b6338

commit_message:
Updated from OpenStack Ansible Tests

Change-Id: Icf238265e56a08db7786e756ee5cbe78c19bbf3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tacker refs/changes/10/517310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION="/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests"# We only want to use zuul-cloner if we detect # zuul v2 running, so we check for the presence # of the ZUUL_REF environment variable. # ref: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/zuul/tree/zuul/ansible/filter/zuul_filters.py?h=feature/zuulv3#n17 if [[ -x /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ]] && [[ "${ZUUL_REF:-none}" != "none" ]]; then # symlink it. As zuul v3 clones into a folder called # 'workspace' we have to use one of its environment # variables to determine the project name. if [[ "${ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME:-none}" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]] ||\ [[ "$(basename ${WORKING_DIR})" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]]; then # In zuul v3 any dependent repository is placed into # /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org, so we check to see # if there is a tests checkout there already. If so, we # symlink that and use it. elif [[ -d "${ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION}" ]]; then ln -s "${ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION}" ${WORKING_DIR}/tests/common # Otherwise we're clearly not in zuul or using a previously setup # repo in some way, so just clone it from upstream. git clone -b stable/ocata \
deleted_lines: if [[ -x /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ]]; then # symlink it. if [[ "$(basename ${WORKING_DIR})" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]]; then git clone -b stable/pike \

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: Id21c6f19f835a3349fbd666d64babb609d3b7243
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tacker refs/changes/06/516306/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION="/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests"# We only want to use zuul-cloner if we detect # zuul v2 running, so we check for the presence # of the ZUUL_REF environment variable. # ref: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/zuul/tree/zuul/ansible/filter/zuul_filters.py?h=feature/zuulv3#n17 if [[ -x /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ]] && [[ "${ZUUL_REF:-none}" != "none" ]]; then # symlink it. As zuul v3 clones into a folder called # 'workspace' we have to use one of its environment # variables to determine the project name. if [[ "${ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME:-none}" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]] ||\ [[ "$(basename ${WORKING_DIR})" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]]; then # In zuul v3 any dependent repository is placed into # /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org, so we check to see # if there is a tests checkout there already. If so, we # symlink that and use it. elif [[ -d "${ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION}" ]]; then ln -s "${ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION}" ${WORKING_DIR}/tests/common # Otherwise we're clearly not in zuul or using a previously setup # repo in some way, so just clone it from upstream. git clone -b stable/ocata \
deleted_lines: if [[ -x /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ]]; then # symlink it. if [[ "$(basename ${WORKING_DIR})" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]]; then git clone -b stable/pike \

commit_message:
Run tripleo projects in tripleo gate queue

We noticed that there were a few tripleo projects that were not properly
being included in the tripleo queue. This change updates the following
projects to run in the tripleo queue.

instack-undercloud
os-apply-config
os-collect-config
os-net-config
os-refresh-config
python-tripleoclient
puppet-tripleo

Change-Id: I49b8f53a45440d861cb57d0b7cdbc30ea16c7ca2

commit_message:
Improve event streaming with a better Octavia verison

In a newer Octavia version we can specify the transport_url for
the event streamer which listens on the neutron rabbit vhost.
This configures that and also enables provisonal status streaming by
default.

Depends-On: I00422b93d3ecfb672e967c2019424b64bc44ba66

Change-Id: I8bee145d5517c66c95bb24ba62cf6f7ed497df2d

commit_message:
Rework r10k verbose option

The command "r10k puppetfile install -v" fails with:
Unrecognized options: verbose.

Rework the command to be compatible with the r10k 1.1.4.

Closes-bug: #1707629

Change-Id: I05d888125284d2808fb248e52afc95ab2b948353
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bogdando@mail.ru>
(cherry picked from commit 885abd1ae0f604fae73fe262493d3b5598613cd0)

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Depends-On: I0391ec310c4eede436011a48490e3c524c8ddf4d
Change-Id: I9e37801b1cd2acb08e59f79541997782a6c7ad99

commit_message:
Add Puppet package to bindep, for module build

We need Puppet package deployed from bindep so we can
run puppet module build with the new zuul v3 job.

Change-Id: I96df8a39bcfcd0cfad961f618ae302f5902444ea

commit_message:
Revert "Don't run sync in upgrades"

Swift fails to deploy when using >1 storage node. The fact `need_sync`
was being set using information from ansible_local in an effort to
support rolling uprades sometime in the future. Sadly this variable
causes storage nodes to be removed from the key sync which results in a
failed build. If we decide serialized rolling uprades are required for
swift we can revisit this however until then we need to remove this
constraint and ensure we're allowing successfule deployments and
upgrades of swift.

This reverts commit 176452bebf7e1ceabd2cf72a89c558c0fc7f1420.

Change-Id: I21318d7c737c2415ef760b46176c3f9b372bb634
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/33/516333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - swift_do_sync | bool - swift_do_sync | bool
deleted_lines: # When doing rolling upgrades, we addres a single node at a time # In these instances, the variables necessary to do sync/key work aren't available, # nor is the sync/key updating necessary. Thus, skip that work on upgrade. - name: Check if installing or upgrading set_fact: need_sync: True when: - ansible_local is defined - ('swift' not in ansible_local['openstack_ansible'] or 'venv_tag' not in ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['swift'] or ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['swift']['venv_tag'] == swift_venv_tag) tags: swift-config - "swift_do_sync | bool" - "need_sync is defined" - "swift_do_sync | bool" - "need_sync is defined"

commit_message:
Updated from OpenStack Ansible Tests

Change-Id: Iad76a59e145227fb22f29f0ce3c2db88b6dbf1ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_octavia refs/changes/02/516302/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION="/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests"# We only want to use zuul-cloner if we detect # zuul v2 running, so we check for the presence # of the ZUUL_REF environment variable. # ref: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/zuul/tree/zuul/ansible/filter/zuul_filters.py?h=feature/zuulv3#n17 if [[ -x /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ]] && [[ "${ZUUL_REF:-none}" != "none" ]]; then # symlink it. As zuul v3 clones into a folder called # 'workspace' we have to use one of its environment # variables to determine the project name. if [[ "${ZUUL_SHORT_PROJECT_NAME:-none}" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]] ||\ [[ "$(basename ${WORKING_DIR})" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]]; then # In zuul v3 any dependent repository is placed into # /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org, so we check to see # if there is a tests checkout there already. If so, we # symlink that and use it. elif [[ -d "${ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION}" ]]; then ln -s "${ZUUL_TESTS_CLONE_LOCATION}" ${WORKING_DIR}/tests/common # Otherwise we're clearly not in zuul or using a previously setup # repo in some way, so just clone it from upstream. git clone -b stable/ocata \
deleted_lines: if [[ -x /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner ]]; then # symlink it. if [[ "$(basename ${WORKING_DIR})" == "openstack-ansible-tests" ]]; then git clone -b stable/pike \

commit_message:
Add basic DevStack installation tutorial

As Outreachy students were asking "where to start with
kuryr-kubernetes?" I've noticed that we don't have tutorial of most
basic DevStack installation. This commit adds such page to the
installation documentation.

Change-Id: I151f32143e4052156f23042e253503a530df0a1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/63/509763/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Basic DevStack installation =========================== Most basic DevStack installation of kuryr-kubernetes is pretty simple. This document aims to be a tutorial through installation steps. Document assumes using Centos 7 OS, but same steps should apply for other operating systems. It is also assumed that ``git`` is already installed on the system. DevStack will make sure to install and configure OpenStack, Kubernetes and dependencies of both systems. Cloning required repositories ----------------------------- First of all you need to clone DevStack: :: $ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstack Create user *stack*, give it required permissions and log in as that user: :: $ ./devstack/tools/create-stack-user.sh $ sudo su stack *stack* user has ``/opt/stack`` set as its home directory. It will need its own repository with DevStack. Also clone kuryr-kubernetes: :: $ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/devstack $ git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes Copy sample ``local.conf`` (DevStack configuration file) to devstack directory: :: $ cp kuryr-kubernetes/devstack/local.conf.sample devstack/local.conf Now edit ``devstack/local.conf`` to set up some initial options: * If you have multiple network interfaces, you need to set ``HOST_IP`` variable to the IP on the interface you want to use as DevStack's primary. * ``KURYR_K8S_LBAAS_USE_OCTAVIA`` can be set to False if you want more lightweight installation. In that case installation of Glance and Nova will be omitted. * If you already have Docker installed on the machine, you can comment out line starting with ``enable_plugin devstack-plugin-container``. Once ``local.conf`` is configured, you can start the installation: :: $ ./devstack/stack.sh Installation takes from 15 to 30 minutes. Once that's done you should see similar output: :: ========================= DevStack Component Timing (times are in seconds) ========================= run_process 5 test_with_retry 2 pip_install 48 osc 121 wait_for_service 1 yum_install 31 dbsync 27 ------------------------- Unaccounted time 125 ========================= Total runtime 360 This is your host IP address: 192.168.101.249 This is your host IPv6 address: fec0::5054:ff:feb0:213a Keystone is serving at http://192.168.101.249/identity/ The default users are: admin and demo The password: password WARNING: Using lib/neutron-legacy is deprecated, and it will be removed in the future Services are running under systemd unit files. For more information see: https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/systemd.html DevStack Version: queens Change: 301d4d1678c3c1342abc03e51a74574f7792a58b Merge "Use "pip list" in check_libs_from_git" 2017-10-04 07:22:59 +0000 OS Version: CentOS 7.4.1708 Core You can test DevStack by sourcing credentials and trying some commands: :: $ source /devstack/openrc admin admin $ openstack service list +----------------------------------+------------------+------------------+ | ID | Name | Type | +----------------------------------+------------------+------------------+ | 091e3e2813cc4904b74b60c41e8a98b3 | kuryr-kubernetes | kuryr-kubernetes | | 2b6076dd5fc04bf180e935f78c12d431 | neutron | network | | b598216086944714aed2c233123fc22d | keystone | identity | +----------------------------------+------------------+------------------+ To test kuryr-kubernetes itself try creating a Kubernetes pod: :: $ kubectl run --image busybox test -- sleep 3600 $ kubectl get pods -o wide NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE IP NODE test-3202410914-1dp7g 0/1 ContainerCreating 0 7s <none> localhost After a moment (even up to few minutes as Docker image needs to be downloaded) you should see that pod got the IP from OpenStack network: :: $ kubectl get pods -o wide NAME READY STATUS RESTARTS AGE IP NODE test-3202410914-1dp7g 1/1 Running 0 35s 10.0.0.73 localhost You can verify that this IP is really assigned to Neutron port: :: [stack@localhost kuryr-kubernetes]$ openstack port list | grep 10.0.0.73 | 3ce7fd13-ad0a-4e92-9b6f-0d38d50b1699 | | fa:16:3e:8e:f4:30 | ip_address='10.0.0.73', subnet_id='ddfbc8e9-68da-48f9-8a05-238ea0607e0d' | ACTIVE | If those steps were successful, then it looks like your DevStack with kuryr-kubernetes is working correctly. In case of errors, copy last ~50 lines of the logs, paste them into `paste.openstack.org <http://paste.openstack.org>`_ and ask other developers for help on `Kuryr's IRC channel <chat.freenode.net:6667/openstack-kuryr>`_. More info on how to use DevStack can be found in `DevStack Documentation <https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/>`_, especially in section `Using Systemd in DevStack <https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/systemd.html>`_, which explains how to use ``systemctl`` to control services and ``journalctl`` to read its logs.

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: Ib83267ef75f91fb8f95af312d644ebe19c6307c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/72/511872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo chown $USER:stack $filename.gz sudo chown $USER:stack $dst_dirname
deleted_lines: sudo chown jenkins:jenkins $filename.gz sudo chown jenkins:jenkins $dst_dirname

commit_message:
Add missing puppet configuration to undercloud deploy

For containerized underclouds, the docker-puppet tool expects
symlinks created for puppet modules by specific paths.
Ensure the client creates those instead of relying on multiple
external places, like quickstart or cuztom bash scripts or docs.

Related-bug: #1723003
Closes-bug: #1725329

Change-Id: I60255386051b80c2fcacb4770e079fd450074c53
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/74/513774/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _configure_puppet(self): print('Configuring puppet modules symlinks ...') subprocess.check_call(['mkdir', '-p', '/etc/puppet/modules/']) subprocess.check_call(['ln', '-sf', '/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules/*', '/etc/puppet/modules/']) # Install required packages and configure puppet self._configure_puppet()

added_lines: # Backup etc cp /etc/sudoers ${LOG_DIR}/etc/sudoers.txt if [ `command -v kubectl` ]; then if [ `command -v oc` ]; then oc login -u developer -p developer fi (kubectl version && kubectl cluster-info && kubectl config view) > ${LOG_DIR}/system_logs/k8s-info.txt 2>&1 kubectl describe all > ${LOG_DIR}/system_logs/k8s-describe-all.txt 2>&1 fi

commit_message:
Merge project-config linter jobs (1/2)

The new ansible lint job works fine, merge the two linter job
and use openstack-zuul-jobs-linters like we do in other config repos.

Since project-config is not self-testing, we need to do this in two
steps.

Change-Id: I6632cce0c80c61171648d5404986ae5f23228d75

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I3f43e9a4593d8b27de25bf2140b467e1351f3792
(cherry picked from commit f425af58848abc0b4a09e8c83560e011f978bd81)

commit_message:
base: use new Linaro repo

During Linaro Connect we decided to create separate repository for Kolla
project requirements. And only for those.

Repository contains:

- libvirt 3.6.0
- qemu 2.10-rc
- dpdk 17.05.2
- openvswitch 2.8.0 (with dpdk support)

Old repository is still available but just for backward compatibility.

Based on change-Id: I40f6b5e58c3c30f2b01b1f1cd5f275cd96a198a3 (instead
of cherry-pick) because Pike has own repo.

Change-Id: I31449599cc40552ed7db704a38dcc31ee80ffcb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/14/514614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Linaro repo for Kolla # dpdk, libvirt, openvswitch, qemu deb http://obs.linaro.org/ERP:/kolla:/pike/Debian_9/ ./

commit_message:
Upgrade rhel_reg_sat_repo to 6.2

When deploying with RHSM, sat-tools 6.2 will be installed instead of 6.1.
The new version is supported by RHEL 7.4 and provides katello-agent package.

Change-Id: I04a9feab02bf606ad6ca923a17947dcca30258da
Closes-Bug: #1728638
(cherry picked from commit b248ae1447940f81513be9904a24197bd4af1126)

commit_message:
RHSM: do not use retry to deploy katello-agent

katello-agent is an optional package, we don't want to use retry.
The package is available or not.

Fixing a regression from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386529
Since we use "| true", we can't really use "retry" here.

Change-Id: Id8cd9ac54e158ee1743b2f72b169b3a066f69168
Closes-Bug: #1728614
(cherry picked from commit d9f7b01c6c21b306005bad12fcab103b0a9e7591)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/43/517143/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: yum install -y katello-agent || true # needed for errata reporting to satellite6
deleted_lines: retry yum install -y katello-agent || true # needed for errata reporting to satellite6

commit_message:
RHSM: do not use retry to deploy katello-agent

katello-agent is an optional package, we don't want to use retry.
The package is available or not.

Fixing a regression from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386529
Since we use "| true", we can't really use "retry" here.

Change-Id: Id8cd9ac54e158ee1743b2f72b169b3a066f69168
Closes-Bug: #1728614
(cherry picked from commit d9f7b01c6c21b306005bad12fcab103b0a9e7591)

deleted_lines: retry yum install -y katello-agent || true # needed for errata reporting to satellite6

commit_message:
fs10: deploy steps with ansible

On FS10, use Ansible to deploy TripleO steps.
For that, it will generate Ansible configuration, download it and
execute it from the undercloud.

Depends-On: I2aa1a04ea8a963b9c613008c12b1efffd365ceaf
Change-Id: Ib7451f59664380d437a9f42efdfad09d070e8072
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/07/508307/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: step_tripleo_config_download: true deploy_steps_ansible: true extra_args: >- -e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/config-download-environment.yaml

commit_message:
Deprecate standalone_network_plugin_ip_version

parameter.  It was deprecated for removal in manila proper in
Pike [1] when IPv6 support was added for network plugins.

[1] I96d3389262e9829b8b4344870cdf5c76abd22828

Needed-By: Ic7e5b5351e429755ba48613ab89d1b7e7d6e2d34
Change-Id: Id36fe900ddf10aacbf06dfe5b27e8cf8982c8e30

commit_message:
Add zuul v3 support/jobs

Setup support for running the linters and functional tests under zuulv3.

Change-Id: I04d1d38b6fb80400ffbe38e803f760b99eadf232
(cherry picked from commit b9d8aa3fd63082e1781e96c97b62cd68d9519a12)

commit_message:
Simplify the logic of validate_network_port

osl.utils provides method is_valid_port to check port, we can
leverage it to make code more clear. Note that the code here was
incorrect in accepting 1-65535, and this change fixes it to also
include 0.

Change-Id: I60cb36a042fd808edca66b07d7248213debd4dff

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: I565fdf75e03fdc1c1296b39f8cff206c7eeccb9a

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I3f43e9a4593d8b27de25bf2140b467e1351f3792

commit_message:
Functional regression test for evacuate with a target

In I6ddcaaca37fc5387c2d2e9f51c67ea9e85acb5c5 we forgot to update the
legacy filter properties dictionary so the requested target wasn't
passed to the scheduler when evacuating.
Adding a functional test for verifying the behaviour.

NOTE(sbauza): The issue has been incendentally fixed in Pike by
I434af8e4ad991ac114dd67d66797a562d16bafe2 so the regression test just
verifies that the expected behaviour works.
The Newton and Ocata backports will be slightly different from that one as we
need to verify that host3 will be preferred eventually over host2.

Related-Bug: #1702454

Change-Id: Id9adb10d2ef821c8b61d8f1d5dc9dd66ec7aaac8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/490997/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import objects from nova.scheduler import filters from nova.scheduler import weights from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers from nova.tests.unit import cast_as_call from nova.tests.unit.image import fake as image_fake from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture from nova.virt import fake class HostNameWeigher(weights.BaseHostWeigher): def _weigh_object(self, host_state, weight_properties): """Arbitrary preferring host1 over host3 over host2.""" weights = {'host1': 100, 'host2': 1, 'host3': 50} return weights.get(host_state.host, 0) class SchedulerOnlyChecksTargetTest(test.TestCase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin): """Regression test for bug 1702454 introduced in Newton. That test is for verifying that if we evacuate by providing a target, the scheduler only checks the related host. If the host is not able to accepting the instance, it would return a NoValidHost to the user instead of passing the instance to another host. Unfortunately, when we wrote the feature for that in Newton, we forgot to transform the new RequestSpec field called `requested_destination` into an item for the legacy filter_properties dictionary so the scheduler wasn't getting it. That test will use 3 hosts: - host1 which will be the source host for the instance - host2 which will be the requested target when evacuating from host1 - host3 which could potentially be the evacuation target if the scheduler doesn't correctly get host2 as the requested destination from the user. """ def setUp(self): super(SchedulerOnlyChecksTargetTest, self).setUp() self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) # The NeutronFixture is needed to stub out validate_networks in API. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) # We need the computes reporting into placement for the filter # scheduler to pick a host. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.PlacementFixture()) api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) # The admin API is used to get the server details to verify the # host on which the server was built. self.admin_api = api_fixture.admin_api self.api = api_fixture.api # the image fake backend needed for image discovery image_fake.stub_out_image_service(self) self.addCleanup(image_fake.FakeImageService_reset) self.start_service('conductor') # We have to get the image before we use 2.latest otherwise we'll get # a 404 on the /images proxy API because of 2.36. self.image_id = self.api.get_images()[0]['id'] # Use the latest microversion available to make sure something does # not regress in new microversions; cap as necessary. self.admin_api.microversion = 'latest' self.api.microversion = 'latest' # The consoleauth service is needed for deleting console tokens when # the server is deleted. self.start_service('consoleauth') self.start_service('conductor') # Define a very basic scheduler that only verifies if host is down. self.flags(enabled_filters=['ComputeFilter'], group='filter_scheduler') # NOTE(sbauza): Use the above weigher so we are sure that # we prefer first host1 for the boot request and forget about any # other weigher. # Host2 should only be preferred over host3 if and only if that's the # only host we verify (as requested_destination does). self.flags(weight_classes=[__name__ + '.HostNameWeigher'], group='filter_scheduler') self.start_service('scheduler') # Let's now start three compute nodes as we said above. # set_nodes() is needed to have each compute service return a # different nodename, so we get two hosts in the list of candidates # for scheduling. Otherwise both hosts will have the same default # nodename "fake-mini". The host passed to start_service controls the # "host" attribute and set_nodes() sets the "nodename" attribute. # We set_nodes() to make host and nodename the same for each compute. fake.set_nodes(['host1']) self.addCleanup(fake.restore_nodes) self.start_service('compute', host='host1') fake.set_nodes(['host2']) self.addCleanup(fake.restore_nodes) self.start_service('compute', host='host2') fake.set_nodes(['host3']) self.addCleanup(fake.restore_nodes) self.start_service('compute', host='host3') self.useFixture(cast_as_call.CastAsCall(self.stubs)) def test_evacuate_server(self): # We first create the instance server = self.admin_api.post_server( dict(server=self._build_minimal_create_server_request( self.api, 'my-pretty-instance-to-evacuate', self.image_id, networks='none'))) server_id = server['id'] self.addCleanup(self.api.delete_server, server_id) self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') # We need to get instance details for knowing its host server = self.admin_api.get_server(server_id) host = server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'] # As weigher prefers host1, we are sure we find it here. self.assertEqual('host1', host) # Now, force host1 to be down. As we use ComputeFilter, it won't never # be a possible destination for the scheduler now. self.admin_api.force_down_service(host, 'nova-compute', True) # It's time to evacuate by asking host2 as a target. Remember, the # only possibility the instance can end up on it is because the # scheduler should only verify the requested destination as host2 # is weighed lower than host3. evacuate = { 'evacuate': { 'host': 'host2' } } self.admin_api.post_server_action(server['id'], evacuate) self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') server = self.admin_api.get_server(server_id) # Yeepee, that works! self.assertEqual('host2', server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'])

commit_message:
Enable network-spaces for swift-storage relation

Ensure that any network space binding provided by the end user
is used as units join the swift-storage relation.

This allows backend communication to swift-storage units to be
network isolated from frontend public access to the swift
deployment.

Change-Id: If29ba3dfb1379f0cda20d9685e654d911d67df1d

in the bug below could have been observed in an HA inspector deployment.

perform a 'finish' state transition, that sets node_info._state = finished
right after the _finish returns.  Therefore a window of state discrepancy
between the node_info.finished() and the node_info._state exists.

This patch closes that window by putting them into a single DB
transaction.

commit_message:
Use db transactions when error-finish is called

Multiple spots were not using DB transactions when processing error
transitions:

  node_info.fsm_event(istate.Events.error)
  node_info.finished(error='Oops!')

which led to race conditions.

The patch replaces these racy calls with a refactored version of
NodeInfo.finished(), that expects an error event as an argument, upon
which the (terminal) error state should be navigated to.

Change-Id: I0bb051d1956a996ed006d55a5ca2d670d9455047
Closes-Bug: #1721233
Closes-Bug: #1721230

Make _abort set error and finished_at in fms_event

TL;DR the fsm_transition decorator has no chance to update anything else
besides the node_info state attribute.  As a result, discrepancies such as
in the bug below could have been observed in an HA inspector deployment.

This patch moves the node_info.finished() and the
node_info.fsm_event(abort) into a single DB transaction to avoid the
discrepancies.

Closes-Bug: #1723384

Fix state discrepancy in process._finish

The _finish calls node_info.finished() inside while being decorated to
perform a 'finish' state transition, that sets node_info._state = finished
right after the _finish returns.  Therefore a window of state discrepancy
between the node_info.finished() and the node_info._state exists.

This patch closes that window by putting them into a single DB
transaction.

Change-Id: I59211885bfec9a9e28a6bc636e0f35ac85eaba23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/52/515352/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Make _abort set error and finished_at in fms_event
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-24 22:57:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/a8478216a74ea5f828ea838acfb4c6ba99ec5e42', 'message': "Make _abort set error and finished_at in fms_event

TL;DR the fsm_transition decorator had no chance to update anything else
besides the node_info state attribute.  As a result, races such as in the
bug below could have been observed in an HA inspector deployment.

Now it is possible to pass the fsm_transition decorator kwargs onto the
fms_evet, to be committed together with the state transition in a single
transaction.

This allows one to decorate a fsm_transition in such a way as to pass
error='Canceled by operator', finished=True and finished_at =
timeutils.utcnow() onto the fsm_event to be committed together with the
state update.

The fsm_transition-decorated _abort was decorated exactly in that way to
allow the fsm_transition to update those fields upon the state change.

Change-Id: I54756b4285939b7e9c4895106a99410e06e1ee2f
Closes-Bug: #1723384

commit_message:
Make _abort set error and finished_at in fms_event

TL;DR the fsm_transition decorator has no chance to update anything else
besides the node_info state attribute.  As a result, discrepancies such as
in the bug below could have been observed in an HA inspector deployment.

This patch moves the node_info.finished() and the
node_info.fsm_event(finish) into a single DB transaction to avoid the
discrepancies.

Change-Id: I54756b4285939b7e9c4895106a99410e06e1ee2f
Closes-Bug: #1723384

added_lines: import functoolsfrom oslo_utils import timeutils@functools.partial(lambda func: lambda: func(error='Canceled by operator', finished=True, finished_at=timeutils.utcnow()))

commit_message:
Relax background introspection abort processing

The introspecion _abort function is decorated as a strictly non-reentrant
state transition, which is a bit of an overkill.

The reason for it being a strict transition was to be able to put the node
introspection into an error state no matter either a cache discrepancy or
an invalid state transition.

This patch relaxes the precondition to only check state transition
validity and apply the transition but drops the ability to put the
introspection into the error state immediately.

Closes-Bug #1721536

Change-Id: Ie3d9faa175852ab772a7ed644a8328f7a4d07e92

commit_message:
Catch node state errors in fsm_transition

The ordering of decortators was wrong. As a result, both the
NodeStateRaceCondition and NodeStateInvalidEvent were leaking to the node
state instead of being reported to the user.

The legitimate use case of those exceptions being introspection error
causes are only in strict (non-reentrant) transitions.

Change-Id: If3c978b178fc9ee2f6c5342a1f399980d0450b41
Related-Bug: #1721536
Related-Bug: #1721512

commit_message:
Stop registering "graphs" resource to quota

As it's a POST-only special purpose resource, quota doesn't
make much sense.  Even worse, it prevents the new quota_details
extension from working if lbaas is configured.

Closes-Bug: #1715594
Change-Id: I9bc85c9bab1fba1ae54259cde6f34f6b8d43b4a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/47/501647/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rework r10k verbose option

The command "r10k puppetfile install -v" fails with:
Unrecognized options: verbose.

Rework the command to be compatible with the r10k 1.1.4.

Closes-bug: #1707629

Change-Id: I05d888125284d2808fb248e52afc95ab2b948353
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bogdando@mail.ru>

commit_message:
Router, RouterPort and FloatingIP to OVO

This patch introduces the Router, RouterPort and FloatingIP model
classes to Oslo-Versioned Object.

Change-Id: I6df6b9d90c6a7281edc39cfafd9ea33e9a7a0b34
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: John David Perkins <john.perkins@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Eli Qiao <liyong.qiao@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/64/307964/23 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-02 11:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/overview_policies.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/92705bb36b4a771a757977d11875e7b929c41741', 'message': 'Fix indent in overview_policies.rst
